page.title: 15Employment
page.content:
As Portland is an Island the most obvious jobs would be those to do with the sea, i.e. fishing. This is, however, a relatively small employer dealing mainly with crabs. A lot of employment is centred around the naval base or 'Dockyard' as it is known. The next place of employment is the Admiralty Research Establishment which deals with submarines and underwater weapons. Other forms of employment include staff for both H.M.Prison and the Youth Custody Centre. There are also general jobs such as shop keepers, secretarial work, police, etc. The oldest and longest running form of employment is working in the quarries although this is now dying out due to mechanisation and drop in demand.
Tonia Douglas, aged 14.
